data.chText: 适合正式场合的；正规的；庄重的

before.enText: of a style of dress, speech, writing, behaviour, etc.

data.enText: very correct and suitable for official or important occasions

data.chText: 晚礼服
data.enText: formal evening dress

data.chText: 这是正式宴会。
data.enText: The dinner was a formal affair.

data.chText: 他使这封信保持正式公文的语气。
data.enText: He kept the tone of the letter formal and businesslike.

data.chText: 她的举止很是郑重其事，有可能会显得不友好。
data.enText: She has a very formal manner, which can seem unfriendly.

data.chText: 正式的；合乎规矩的
data.enText: official; following an agreed or official way of doing things

data.chText: 正式法律程序
data.enText: formal legal processes

data.chText: 正式道歉 / 投诉 / 要求
data.enText: to make a formal apology/complaint/request

data.chText: 两国于十二月重新建立了正式外交关系。
data.enText: Formal diplomatic relations between the two countries were re-established in December.

data.chText: 是应该把这些安排做得略为正式一点的时候了。
data.enText: It is time to put these arrangements on a slightly more formal basis.

data.chText: 正规的
data.enText: received in a school, college or university, with lessons, exams, etc., rather than gained just through practical experience

data.chText: 他没有正规的教学资历证明。
data.enText: He has no formal teaching qualifications.

data.chText: 幼儿有时早在四岁时就开始接受正规教育。
data.enText: Young children are beginning their formal education sometimes as early as four years old.

data.chText: 方式上的；做法上的；形式上的
data.enText: concerned with the way sth is done rather than what is done

data.chText: 寻求计划获得批准纯粹是一个形式上的问题，没有人会认真反对的。
data.enText: Getting approval for the plan is a purely formal matter; nobody will seriously oppose it.

data.chText: 评论家过多地集中评论她诗歌的形式，而没有真正看其内容。
data.enText: Critics have concentrated too much on the formal elements of her poetry, without really looking at what it is saying.

data.chText: 整齐的；布置井然的

before.enText: of a garden, room or building

data.enText: arranged in a regular manner, according to a clear, exact plan

data.chText: 精心布置的有片片草坪和林荫道的宜人花园
data.enText: delightful formal gardens, with terraced lawns and an avenue of trees

data.chText: “你好！”她很正式地说。
data.enText: ‘How do you do?’ she said formally.

data.chText: 账目已由董事会正式批准。
data.enText: The accounts were formally approved by the board.

data.chText: 虽然他不是科班出身的艺术史学家，但他对这一时期的知识却普遍为人尊重。
data.enText: Although not formally trained as an art historian, he is widely respected for his knowledge of the period.

simple_means.memory_skill: form 形式 + al …的 → 正式的，正规的

tr: a lavish dance requiring formal attire
refined or imposing in manner or appearance
being in accord with established forms and conventions and requirements (as e.g. of formal dress)
example: the requirement was only formal and often ignored

tr: (of spoken and written language) adhering to traditional standards of correctness and without casual, contracted, and colloquial forms
example: the paper was written in formal English

tr: characteristic of or befitting a person in authority
represented in simplified or symbolic form

value.def: Formal speech or behaviour is very correct and serious rather than relaxed and friendly, and is used especially in official situations.

example.ex: He wrote a very formal letter of apology to Douglas...
example.tran: 他给道格拉斯写了一封非常正式的道歉信。

example.ex: Business relationships are necessarily a bit more formal.
example.tran: 商业关系有必要更正式一些。

example.ex: He took her back to Vincent Square in a taxi, saying goodnight formally on the doorstep.
example.tran: 他打车把她送回了文森特广场，并在门口正式道了晚安。

example.ex: Lillith's formality and seriousness amused him.
example.tran: 利莉思的拘礼和严肃让他觉得好笑。

value.def: A formal action, statement, or request is an official one.

example.ex: UN officials said a formal request was passed to American authorities...
example.tran: 联合国官员称正式请求已向美国当局转达。

example.ex: No formal announcement had been made.
example.tran: 尚无任何官方声明。

example.ex: ...a formal application.
example.tran: 正式的申请

value.tran: (行为、声明或要求)官方的，正式的

example.ex: Diplomats haven't formally agreed to Anderson's plan...
example.tran: 外交官们还没有正式同意安德森的方案。

example.ex: They are now formally separated and they will continue to lead their own lives.
example.tran: 他们现在正式分开了，将会继续各自的生活。

value.def: Formal occasions are special occasions at which people wear smart clothes and behave according to a set of accepted rules.

example.ex: One evening the film company arranged a formal dinner after the play.
example.tran: 一天晚上，电影公司在演出结束后安排了一个正式的晚宴。

example.ex: ...a wide array of events, including school formals and speech nights, weddings, and balls.
example.tran: 包括学校正式舞会、演讲之夜、婚礼和大型舞会等一系列丰富多样的活动

value.def: Formal clothes are very smart clothes that are suitable for formal occasions.

example.ex: They wore ordinary ties instead of the more formal high collar and cravat.
example.tran: 他们打着普通的领带，而不是更为正式的高领领结。

value.tran: (服饰)正规的，正式的，适合正式场合的

example.ex: It was really too warm for her to dress so formally.
example.tran: 她穿得如此正式，实在是太热了。

value.def: Something that is done, written, or studied in a formal way has a very ordered, organized method or style.

example.ex: This does not encourage the child to analyse the environment in a formal way...
example.tran: 这并不能鼓励孩子有条理地分析周围的环境。

example.ex: Classic Greek drama was written in verse, usually in an elevated and formal style.
example.tran: 古典希腊戏剧以韵文写成，通常用词讲究、结构整齐。

example.ex: ...a formal methodology.
example.tran: 结构严谨的方法论

value.tran: 整齐的;规矩的;井然有序的

value.def: Formal education or training is given officially, usually in a school, college, or university.

example.ex: Although his formal education stopped after primary school, he was an avid reader...
example.tran: 尽管小学毕业后就再没有受过正规的教育，他却十分爱读书。

example.ex: Leroy didn't have any formal dance training.
example.tran: 勒罗伊没受过任何正规的舞蹈训练。

example.ex: Mr Dawe was the ancient, formally trained head gardener.
example.tran: 道先生是那种老式的、正规科班出身的首席园艺师。

value.def: A formal garden or room is arranged in a very regular and controlled way, especially according to certain rules of design.

example.ex: ...a formal herb garden...
example.tran: 布局匀称的草药园

example.ex: The Coronata wallpaper lends a formal air to the dining room.
example.tran: 科罗娜塔墙纸给餐厅增添了一种整齐有致的气氛。

value.tran: (尤指按照某种设计规则)布局匀称的，布置整齐的

trans: 形式分析；形式化分析；正规分析
形式定义；正式定义；形式化定义；正式的定义
形式化系统；正式的系统；形式系統；形式系统；形式体系
形式上的当事人；名义上的当事人
要式合同；正式合同；正式契约
形式模型；形式化模型；正规模型；规范模型；正式模型
形式验证；形式化验证；功能验证；形式证明；正式验证
正式邀请；正式邀请信；正式请柬；正式的邀请；正式请帖
形式理论；形式论；形式化理论；规范理论；形式理論

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to form, shape 形成；形状, 形式
rootsaffixes.title: form

partsOfSpeech.dec: aqui〔= aqu 水〕+ form 形成；形状，形式 → 水状的
con 共同 + form 形成；形状，形式 → 共同的形式 → 使一致
cruci 十字形 + form 形成；形状，形式 → 十字形的
de 坏 + form 形成；形状，形式 → 破坏形状 → 变形
form 形成；形状，形式 + al …的 → 正式的，正规的
form 形成；形状，形式 + al 表名词 + ism 主义 → 形式主义
form 形成；形状，形式 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 形成；培养
form 形成；形状，形式 + ula → 形成的东西 → 公式
formul〔a〕公式；信条 + ate 使… → 使形成公式 → 公式化
in 使… + form 形成；形状，形式 → 使〔大家知道的〕形式 → 通知
in 使 + form 形成；形状，形式 + ative，inform 的形容词 → 情报的；见多识广的
multi 多 + form 形成；形状，形式 → 多形状的
per 假 + form 形成；形状，形式 → 假形式 → 表演
re 一再 + form 形成；形状，形式 → 重新形成 → 改造
trans 变换 + form 形成；形状，形式 → 变形；改造
uni 一个 + form 形成；形状，形式 → 一种形状 → 一致的
